strings.onboardLongDescription: With opportunities for surfing, windsurfing, kayaking and obviously swimming, as well as more intense outdoor activities like cage diving with Great White Sharks, a day in Durban will absolutely satisfy your wanderlust.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.shortDescription: Discover Howick Falls and visit Ardmore Ceramics
activities.longDescription: Venture into the heart of the Natal Midlands to Howick, the home of the 300-foot Howick Falls -- located almost right in the center of the picturesque town itself. After a luncheon at the Granny Mouse Country House, head to Ardmore Lavendula, the largest ceramic art studio in South Africa. Visit the ceramic shop and see some of their prestigious handcrafted designs.

activities.introduction: Marvel at the majestic Howick Falls, then learn all about the ceramics tradition of Ardmore Lavendula, the largest ceramic art studio in South Africa.

activities.shortDescription: Enjoy the stunning scenes of the coast
activities.longDescription: Start the day with a drive toward the Golden Mile, before taking a scenic journey along the North Coast shoreline (also known as the Dolphin Coast). Visit Umhlanga Rocks, situated just north of the vibrant city of Durban, then follow the the golden sandy beaches that stretch northwards to the spectacular world heritage site of Greater St. Lucia Wetland Park. Stop at the Oyster Box hotel for delicious afternoon tea before heading back to Durban.

activities.shortDescription: Spend the day exploring the Gwahumbe Game Reserve
activities.longDescription: Always wanted to see the wildlife of Africa? Now's your chance. The Gwahumbe Game Reserve is full of hippos, giraffes, zebras, and antelopes, and you'll get a chance to see them all on this game drive by 4x4. Overlooking the confluence of the Gwahumbe and Umsunduze Rivers, the reserve consists of 3,000 acres of beautiful riverine forest, valley bushvelt, plateau grassland, and majestic cliff faces.

activities.shortDescription: A zip-lining adventure through the Karkloof forest
activities.longDescription: Strap on your harness and get ready to glide from platform to platform via steel cable, across a lush forest canopy. You'll spend a few minutes on each platform while your guides explain the ecology of the forest, and describe the different trees and wildlife surrounding you. You'll have a chance to see Emerald Cuckoos, Knysna Loeries, a variety of raptors, and if you're lucky, endangered Cape Parrots. Once you're back on the ground, enjoy a light lunch.

activities.shortDescription: Spend a half day among these brilliant creatures
activities.longDescription: After meeting your guide at Durban Harbour you’ll take the picturesque drive up the coast to Ballito, home of Monkeyland, a free-roaming, multi-species primate sanctuary aiming to educate the public of the threats and challenges these animals face daily. Here you’ll see capuchin monkeys, ringtail and black and white ruffed lemurs, buff cheeked gibbons, squirrel monkeys, howler monkeys and more on both a safari vehicle and walking tour before returning. Monkeyland has a strict no-touch policy.

activities.shortDescription: Explore the site where Nelson Mandela was captured
activities.longDescription: Start the day with a guided tour of the Nelson Mandela Capture Site in the Midlands, where Nelson Mandela was arrested on August 5, 1962. After a tour of the site and museum, you'll have some free time to shop before heading to Howick Falls in the heart of the Natal Midlands. The towering falls were known to the Zulu people as "The Place of the Tall One." At the end of the tour, you will return to the quayside in Durban.

activities.shortDescription: Get acquainted with all the highlights of Durban
activities.longDescription: Set out in an air-conditioned coach for a sightseeing tour of this sub-tropical city. Follow the Victoria Embankment past the Vasco Da Gama Clock and Dick King Statue en route to Curie Hill for panoramic city views. Continue on to the Durban Botanical Gardens and get the chance to get out to explore the colorful flora. End the day with a drive along the Golden Mile beachfront, passing the Juma Mosque, the largest in the Southern Hemisphere.

activities.shortDescription: Engross yourself in the magic of Durban
activities.longDescription: The Tala Game Reserve offers one of the most popular game drives around, spanning 3,000 hectares, or nearly 7,500 acres, Tala is home to 380 species of birds, countless big game, including kudu, hippos, giraffes and wildebeests and even more natural flora. On your drive you’ll be with experienced game rangers who will provide narration about everything you're seeing during this once-in-a-lifetime experience.

activities.shortDescription: Visit Durban's market and botanical gardens
activities.longDescription: Drive from the quayside to the Durban Victoria Street Market, a covered market with hundreds of stalls selling spices, handicrafts, jewelry, food, clothing, and more. After a guided tour here, and some free time for shopping, you'll head to the Durban Botanical Gardens -- Africa's oldest surviving botanic garden. This sprawling garden is home to major collections of indigenous and exotic flora, like cycads, palms, and orchids.
